attribs.name: proficiencies
attribs.current: Tools:  Tinker's Tools, Smith's Tools, Vehicles (land)

attribs.name: miscellaneous_notes
attribs.current:
Full name:  Zinia "Tink" Nacklerock

Artificer's Lore:  Intelligence (History) check related to MAGIC items, ALCHEMICAL objects, or TECHNOLOGICAL devices, add TWICE your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

Tinker:  proficiency with Tinker's tools. Spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless 1 hour spent repairing), or use an action to dismantle. Reclaim materials used to create it. Up to three devices.
   Clockwork Toy:  Moves 5' across the ground on each turn in random direction. Makes noises appropriate to creature it represents.
   Fire Starter:  produces miniature flame to light candle, torch, campfire. Action required to use.
   Music Box:  plays a single song at moderate volume. Stops playing when it reaches song's end or when closed.

Gnome Cunning:  ADVANTAGE on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws vs magic.

Class Features
    Arcane Recovery:  once a day after short rest, recover spell slots equal to or less than half wizard level (round up), nothing 6th or higher.

    Arcane Tradition: Artificer (Unearthed Arcana version)

    Infuse Potions:  Can produce magic potions. 10 minutes focusing magic on a vial of mundane water and expend a spell slot to transform it into a potion. Once expended, slot cannot be regained until potion i s consumed or after 1 week (potion then loses effectiveness). Can create up to 3 potions. Spell slot expended determines potion type.
              Spell Slot:  1st=climbing, growth, healing; 2nd=Mind reading, greater healing; 3rd=Invisibility, superior healing, water breathing; 4th=resistance

    Infuse Scrolls:  Can use Arcane Recovery to create a scroll instead of regaining expended spell slots. Finish a short rest, spend 10 minutes w/parchment, quill, ink to create a SPELL SCROLL containing one spell chosen from those known. Subtract spell's level from total levels worth of slots regained using Arcane Recovery. Reduction applies until scroll is used and then finish long rest.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
Collector. I collect souvenirs (books, knowledge, maps) from every place I've been.

Educated. I value education, knowledge, and intelligence (especially my own!).

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Knowledge through experience. The best way to learn about the world is to live in it actively.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I am dedicated to mastery of my craft and driven to solving the mystery of the Dragonshard's purpose.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: I don't mean to, but I get incredibly absorbed in academia and can be absentminded towards friends. I say things that are on the surface accurate but can be incredibly harsh or hurtful.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-KDUrxpIR8cZweZJ7npI_content
attribs.current: backpack, lore book, ink, pen, parchment, sand, small knife

attribs.name: repeating_classfeature_-KEDN5sVKAH09ajsPWr0_freetext
attribs.current:
You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level of [[round(@{wizard_level} / 2)]] (half your wizard level rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.
For example, if you're a 4th-level wizard, you can recover up to two levels worth of spell slots. You can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level spell slots.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-KGr-J5tWMdv2bvlKCwV_name
attribs.current: ancient book of animated diagrams of dwarven siege engines

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-KGr-P87WxPcbB2btM2Q_name
attribs.current: A fractured brass miniature of a ship upon a pile of powder and shards of amber (scrap metal and the largest pieces of amber may be useable)

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgL4EtNLM5cEncR_content
attribs.current:
Sense presence of magic within 30 ft. If magic is sensed, use action to see faint aura around visible creature or object in area, learn its school of magic.

Penetrates most barriers but blocked by 1ft stone, 1in metal, thin sheet of lead, or 3ft wood/dirt.

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgM1AGL6Mf1EIu1_materials
attribs.current: pearl worth 100gp and an owl feather

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgM1AGL6Mf1EIu1_content
attribs.current:
Touch object throughout casting of spell. If magic/magic-imbued, learn properties and  how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, number of charges. Learn of any spells affecting the item and what they are. If created by a spell, learn which spell.

If creature, learn what Spells are affecting it.

attribs.name: repeating_spell0_-KgXnxgM1AGL6Mf1EIu2_content
attribs.current:
Create one of the following magical effects within range.

• Instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

• Instantaneously light or snuff out a Candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

• Instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

• Chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

• Make a color, a small mark, or a Symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

• Create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell0_-KgXnxgNtOmDzDvm6fQn_content
attribs.current:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell0_-KgXnxgNtOmDzDvm6fQo_content
attribs.current:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn clack, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object.

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgOX6FUEG3oQC2p_content
attribs.current: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends it if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgOX6FUEG3oQC2q_content
attribs.current: You touch a creature. The target's speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgP1abusPGdAVbP_content
attribs.current: An Invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering Attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgP1abusPGdAVbQ_materials
attribs.current: a bit of pork rind or butter

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgP1abusPGdAVbQ_content
attribs.current:
Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into difficult terrain for the Duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

attribs.name: repeating_spell2_-KgXnxgP1abusPGdAVbR_content
attribs.current:
You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.

If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

Enlarge. The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category - from Medium to Large, for example. If there isn't enough room for the target to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, the target's attack with them deal 1d4 extra damage.

Reduce. The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category - from Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgP1abusPGdAVbS_materials
attribs.current: A pinch of soot and salt

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgP1abusPGdAVbS_content
attribs.current:
For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface of which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text.

This spell doesn't decode secret messages in a text or glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn't part of a written language.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KDZhfx60gdSrOFQYYGP_content
attribs.current: I know someone (or someone knows me) in every place I've traveled. I can hide, rest, or recuperate among people I've known unless I've shown myself to be a danger or too much of a nuisance. They will help me but not to the risk of their well-being.

attribs.name: repeating_classfeature_-KgXnxgd5Xp07mJeqklZ_content
attribs.current:
You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level of [[round(@{wizard_level} / 2)]] (half your wizard level rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.
For example, if you're a 4th-level wizard, you can recover up to two levels worth of spell slots. You can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level spell slots.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-KDUq4chw3cIZ4z1KN5t_attack_string
attribs.current: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target.

attribs.name: classfeatures_chat_var

attribs.name: repeating_spell1_-KgXnxgOX6FUEG3oQC2q_higher_level
attribs.current: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_classfeature_-KgXo-aGZhzQNZvA6N3t_content
attribs.current: Your understanding of magic items allows you to analyze and understand their secrets. You know the artificer spells detect magic and identify, and you can cast them as rituals. You don't need to provide a material component when casting identify with this class feature.
